titles.title: Wild Horse and Burro Preservation and Management Act of 1999

To amend the Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Act to provide for delegation to States of the powers and duties under that Act regarding management of wild free-roaming horses and burros, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 9/15/1999--Introduced. Wild Horse and Burro Preservation and Management Act of 1999 - Amends the Wild Free- Roaming Horses and Burros Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior, upon the request of the Governor of a State, to delegate to the State the powers and duties of the Secretary under such Act with respect to wild free-roaming horses and burros in the State.Requires the Secretary to allocate to each State, from sums not needed to administer adoptions of wild horses and burros, an amount based on the State's relative population of wild free-roaming horses and burros, to be used only for activities under this Act.Directs the Secretary, acting through the Bureau of Land Management, to conduct a national media campaign to increase public awareness of the wild free-roaming horses and burros adoption program. Authorizes appropriations.
